title: Financial dimensions of well-being in older age
abstractText:
The aim of this project is to generate new knowledge and understanding of the financial dimensions of well-being among older people in the UK.
The objectives are:

  • to understand the dominant patterns of expenditure among older people
  • to explore how patterns of consumer borrowing, financial inclusion and over-indebtedness vary into and beyond retirement
  • to determine the main components of wealth and how these vary into and beyond retirement
  • to establish the relationship between financial well-being and quality of life among older people.

The methods used will include cluster analysis, multilevel analysis, multivariate logistic regression and longitudinal analysis. Seven major survey data sources (five with a UK/English focus and two international) will be analysed, complemented by a rigorous framework analysis of two qualitative datasets using specialist qualitative software. The findings will provide a complete view of financial well-being among older people.

A further key objective is to effectively disseminate the research findings and methodology to the academic community, policy makers and practitioners. This will be achieved by:

  • producing a comprehensive research report
  • submitting three articles to policy-relevant peer-reviewed journals
  • hosting a research symposium
  • a range of seminars and methodological presentations
  • presenting our work at three conferences.
